SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: The complement cascade has been implicated in cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury
To develop clinically useful therapies that successfully manipulate the complement cascade, the individual roles of its components must be clearly defined
Previous studies have shown that C5 inhibition improves outcome after experimental stroke
In this study, we investigated the role of C5a in stroke injury by inhibiting its activity at the receptor level
METHODS: C5a receptor antagonist or vehicle was administered to mice before temporary middle cerebral artery occlusion
Stroke outcomes were assessed 24 hours later in all mice using both neurological deficit scores and cerebral infarct volumes
RESULTS: Animals treated with C5a receptor antagonist experienced significantly decreased infarct volume and demonstrated an improving trend in neurological function
CONCLUSION: These findings demonstrate that modulation of C5a receptor activity significantly alters the degree of neurological damage after experimental reperfused stroke
